ticket.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins
ticket.original-body:
we can pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins.
for example: @@@ rails plugin install --branch rails3 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git will run: git init git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git rails3 remove .git .gitignore @@@
@@@ rails plugin install --revision d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148 --branch rails3 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git will run: git init git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git rails3 && git reset --hard d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148 remove .git .gitignore @@@
@@@ rails plugin install --revision d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git will run: git init git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git && git reset --hard d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148 remove .git .gitignore @@@
other things havn't changed.
thanks.

thanks.
ticket.original-body-html:
we can pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins.

for example:

rails plugin install --branch rails3 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git 
will run:
git init
git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git rails3
remove .git .gitignore

rails plugin install --revision d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148 --branch rails3 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git 
will run:
git init
git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git rails3 && git reset --hard d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148
remove .git .gitignore

rails plugin install --revision d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git 
will run:
git init
git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git && git reset --hard d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148
remove .git .gitignore

other things havn't changed.

thanks.

thanks.

for example:

rails plugin install --branch rails3 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git 
will run:

git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git rails3

git init
git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git rails3 && git reset --hard d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148
remove .git .gitignore

rails plugin install --revision d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148 git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git 
will run:
git init
git pull git://github.com:jinzhu/acts_as_rateable.git && git reset --hard d71ae3a72b04579fdc270ccabcd31ad17fc22148
remove .git .gitignore

other things havn't changed.

thanks.
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins

version.body:
I only see the patch for Git, is that correct?
I somewhat think this is a good idea, but then will it be much slower using `git pull` without `--depth`?
Anyway, if the speed is not the problem, then I think this would help so that people wouldn't have to specify specific ref on that brach, for instance if they want to install the `obsolete` branch.
version.body-html:
I only see the patch for Git, is that correct?

I somewhat think this is a good idea, but then will it be much slower using git pull without --depth?

Anyway, if the speed is not the problem, then I think this would help so that people wouldn't have to specify specific ref on that brach, for instance if they want to install the obsolete branch.
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins

version.body:
yeah, I only add the patch for git.
as I test,I don't think it will be much slower. ;)
there is another version, in this version, it's will keep the `--depth 1` unless you specify the `--revision`.
thanks.
version.body-html:
yeah, I only add the patch for git.

as I test,I don't think it will be much slower. ;)

there is another version, in this version, it's will keep the --depth 1 unless you specify the --revision.

thanks.
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins

version.body: This can use `--revision branchname`, doesn't need a new option.
version.body-html: This can use --revision branchname, doesn't need a new option.
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins

version.body:
yeah, I know that, there is no document.and not easy to understand.
this patch provide more options, you can install a plugin by *branchname* and *commit ref*
version.body-html:
yeah, I know that, there is no document.and not easy to understand.

this patch provide more options, you can install a plugin by branchname and commit ref
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins

version.body: -1 on adding more options that do the same thing. Better to improve the docs.
version.body-html: -1 on adding more options that do the same thing. Better to improve the docs.
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins

version.body: do you think they are doing the same thing? can you install plugin by `commit's ref` rightnow? I think you totally misunderstood me.
version.body-html:
do you think they are doing the same thing? can you install plugin by commit's ref rightnow?
I think you totally misunderstood me.
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins

version.body:
Maybe I totally misunderstand: you added support for installing a specific revision, then you added support for --branch.
In git, these are both refs. You're installing a plugin at a specific ref, whether it's a revhash or a branch or a tag.
So we only need one option. Ideally, this would be an argument instead of a special option, and it would default to "master"
(Keeping the same options as svn is not necessary, either.)
version.body-html:
Maybe I totally misunderstand: you added support for installing a specific revision, then you added support for --branch.

In git, these are both refs. You're installing a plugin at a specific ref, whether it's a revhash or a branch or a tag.

So we only need one option. Ideally, this would be an argument instead of a special option, and it would default to "master"

(Keeping the same options as svn is not necessary, either.)
version.title: [PATCH] Install Plugin: pass -b/--branch BRANCH for git plugins and -r/--revision REVISION for git/subversion plugins
